39458829.review:
For a small team of developers, I have to take off my hat to them!
The game has a really good atmosphere in VR that just elevates the immersion to a level you completely get lost in that creepy world. The inventory and the map are very well executed, just loved the idea of interacting with the map and using stamps to mark the locations. It would be cool to be able to write your own notes on the map if the developers implement it later on or in another game. These little details just add so much to the overall immersion where VR really just shines!

39108482.review: This game does darkness and horror well. The best VR horror game in my book.

38958497.review:
Visually poor, locomotion and interactions are weak, has glitches with the pistol in the first 5 minutes...
Not recommended.

[Played on VIVE]

38796098.review:
Increíble reminiscencia de los primeros silent hill. Todo aquel que haya jugado esta saga, debería probar ésto. 
Su gráfica es similar al sh 2 y 4, con una excelente grado de inmersión. Hay buenos puzzles, variados escenarios, jefes, armas, baúl para guardar items, etc. Ademas cuenta con movimiento libre y teletransporte, aunque es recomendable el primero, para este tipo de experiencias.
Si nunca jugaste a los primeros silent hills, tienes un alto riesgo de quedar atascado.
Aun así, te diría que lo pruebes.
De los mejores survival horror que he jugado en RV. :)

38691068.review:
Awesome display of Horror VR. Someone else reviewed this with the line, "If Silent Hill & Resident Evil had a baby", and that's exatly what this is. From the music and exploration feel, so reminiscent to SH, yet with the shooting dynamics of RE. So much fun. 

Very few cheap thrills, mostly a never ending coalesscene of dread building up as your hairs stand up on the back of your neck.

There's an aspect to the game that really has my mind in a twist, and that's the prevalence of organ tissue througout the game, it's always throbbing, pulsating, squishing and sloshing, it's everywhere. Reminds me of the Zerg. I haven't finished the game yet, but I can't help but wonder if in the game, I'm in some sort of coma from a brain surgery or operation gone wrong. That's the impression I get. Trapped in an endless hell in my mind.

38604148.review:
This is the best single player VR game I played (and I played a lot of different ones). 

The ambiance, the level design, the twisted puzzles, the monsters, the combat that is about saving your scarce resources. Everything is on point. 
It really does honor the old Resident Evil and Silent Hill series, and any fan of that genre should experience it in VR.

An absolute must have.

(I finished the game in about 4 hours)

38585149.review:
This games deserves to be much more popular and put into the public eye than it is right now.

Organ Quarter is a very nice game that mixes survival horror and virtual reailty together. It shows most resemblance to the older Silent Hill and Resident Evil games (as most people have said, it is not a wave shooter), with puzzle solving, horrific environments [spoiler] (including an apartment building, theatre, bar/club, mine, and a hospital) [/spoiler] to explore, save rooms, a lower emphasis on action, boss battles, and limited ammo. 

My only criticisms include that the graphics are not wonderful and the story is on the shorter side (taking about 4 1/2 hours on my first playthrough) -- though this is redeemed due to the price being very low, and the difficulty of the puzzles and the difficulty of the game could be a little greater. 

But, these criticisms are fairly small and I genuinely hope that a second game would be made.

38299100.review:
See the full video review here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-yIEdyVMoPQ

Organ Quarter is VR Survival Horror which has been compared to Resident Evil or Silent Hill and I do have to say that it does remind me of the older survival horror games. It's compatible with the HTC Vive, Oculus Rift and even the Windows headsets. 

In this game you will explore the area, manage your resources, solve puzzles and try to survive until you reach the end of this horror adventure. There are two difficulty options. Survival horror which I played and casual which is said to be more forgiving.


You start in your apartment room, only armed with a torch and a map of the building. You look through the rooms for resources, bullets, weapons and medical equipment. The items can be hidden quite well. Under beds, down the side of a bookshelf and so on. 

At first you'll need to avoid enemies, but throughout the game you can find various weapons. 
Whether you'll be careful enough with your bullets to keep using them is another question.
You do have to manage your resources quite well, so avoiding enemies can still be the better option.

There are a variety of puzzles in the game. Some quite obvious such as placing a found item into a similar shaped slot, where some require more thought such as placing certain items in an order based on a clue in the same room.


Organ Quarter's graphics are nothing amazing. You can tell it's definitely an indie game, but while it's not very graphically impressive, the aesthetic is done very well. This combined with the audio, both the sounds, background music and voices which are brilliant to really give you that oppressive horror atmosphere, keeping you on edge.

Of the horror games I've played so far, this one has done the best at creating the correct atmosphere and it doesn't rely on jump-scares to do it, unlike some others.

38087980.review: Great game so far! With by far one of the best methods of keeping track of things due to their map with custom markers you can use!

38043944.review: Silent Hill in vr w/o the big budget. Took me 4.4 hrs to finish.  Good stuff.

38011179.review:
Lets play video https://youtu.be/HWpGdaDvyhQ  (Part one)
If your a fan of Silent hill 1,2 and 3.... Than your in for a real treat!!!! This game brings back the nostalgia of the PS2 Silent hill graphics, and even has the amazing music, creepy atmosphere and really creepy creatures to go along with it. You feel like you are stepping into a silent hill type game.

Pros-
Graphics
Audio/Sound FX/atmosphere
Mechanics (I love how you can mark the map!!!) Super neat and adds to immersion. 
Multiple locomotion options plus optional comfort vignette 
Performance - Because of the PS2 like graphics, I can see this working very well with a lower graphics card too! That is great!
Really neat inventory system! Love it!

I only made it to the 2nd save point then took a break and had to write this review. Can't wait to keep playing though. Speaking of Save point!! What a neat idea!!! I love it!!!

I really don't have any cons. So far everything is awesome! 

I do game design also and would love to chat with the developer!! I was working on a similar silent hill type game actually. :)

Keep up the good work, can't wait to see what else you come up with!

37918807.review: This game has me hooked.  I never played Silent Hill but it does remind me of other old survival horror games.  Great atmosphere's that send chills throughout your entire body.  The music is really excellent.  Would highly recommend this to fans of survival horror.

37772254.review: Great throwback to the Silent Hill 2 era, only this time you are actually there. One of the strange things in VR is that even the PS2 graphics doesn't hinder the map and NPCs from seeming real and plastic, but instead adds to the atmosphere. Speaking of which, the soundtrack and ambience is top notch! Actually, I think I have to finish writing this review right now and see if it is available on YouTube :D

37428308.review: It's pretty "meaty" for a vr game

36943628.review:
If you liked early Resident Evil games, Silent Hill games or Cry of Fear, you will absolutely like this game. It does a good job of porting classic survival horror mechanics to VR. For example, you collect maps for each area and have stamps/markers with symbols to mark doors locked with special keys, safe rooms, items left behind, etc however you like on your map. There are no jumpscares (unless you didn't see an enemy and it surprised you), the horror comes from the eerie atmosphere, creepy monsters, soundtrack and sound design. 
I finished the game in 6 hours. I highly suggest survival difficulty, since the game is not very difficult due to an abundance of ammo and medicine (at least for a horror game).

36880485.review: This game really captures the feel of being in Silent Hill, dream come true. Developer is very friendly and listens to feedback.  Exploring a hellish landscape armed with a limited inventory, and a map with a marker has never been so much fun.

36591460.review:
Its kinda like walking around in a low-budget silent hill game.  If you don't like the ps2 style and static filter then you probably won't be able to tolerate the game.
I enjoyed it very much and its pretty much the only full-length single player game I've played so far in VR.  It feels like an actual game rather than a tech demo or gimmick-fest.

The story isn't profound or anything but it kept me interested.

The negatives:
The game is too dark too often and gives me a headach or eye strain or something if I play for more than 40 minutes.
The game is way too easy.  There are sooo many items and most of the enemies are too dumb to get you so you can walk right by them.

36576598.review:
This is Silent Hill VR scary awesome hrs of game play
Track pad locomotion easy inventory and saves

36557108.review: The influences here are apparent and all things that I love: the dreamscape puzzles of David Lynch, the nightmarish community of Silent Hill, the industrial melancholy of Akira Yamaoka, the body horror of David Cronenberg. This game has fantastic atmosphere, engaging mystery, terrifying enemies and a unique presentation style. I was already in love when I had to stick my head into the open meat-maw of a television to save.

36543441.review: I'm about an hour and a half into this game and am really enjoying it.  The atmosphere is great.  Creepy horror places and creepy better lit areas where I don't freak out so much.  Its got a nice balance.  I recommend it so far.

36531817.review: games is pretty creapy , liking it so far

36506144.review: This game was Amazing!!! It's very atmospheric and super creepy (the noises get you). It has a kind of trippy Silent Hill feel to it. Once I grew a pair and reminded myself that it's just a game, it kept me wanting more with its good blend of puzzle solving and FPS. Love the inventory management.  Definitely recommend this one..

36477211.review:
F*cking WONDERFUL. There have been only a handful of games that made me think "I'm so glad I have VR for this experience", and this is the latest one.
This game vibes like a beautiful love letter to the early Silent Hills and Cronenberg films with mysterious surreality and atmosphere. Props to whoever did the music for this, it really nails it. There's also something weirdly satisfying about having to mark off your own map.
It's a little raw in places- definitely feels like a game that came from a smaller studio- but by the end I sort of fell in love with that charm.
I was legit upset when I finished this because I could wander around this world forever.

36437393.review:
This is one of the better VR games available as of this writing. If you're a fan of classic survival horror, especially Silent Hill, this is your game. 

Like the older Silent Hill games, this doesn't try to be an in-your-face scary game. It's more about the oppressive atmosphere and the looming presence. Most of your time is going to be spent wandering around decrepit buildings and streets, checking doors, solving puzzles and dodging monsters. One feature is that it has a map system much like the old Silent Hill games except you have to manually mark your map as you find doors locked or passages blocked off. Maybe that sounds tedious but it's actually pretty neat.

As for graphics, the aesthetic is great even though it's a relatively low fidelity game. It actually feels like you're in Silent Hill 1. There's a mix of fleshy, gross, organic architecture and rusty, bloody, crumbling architecture. It's perfect and it's a whole new experience when you have to traverse these kinds of locations in a first person VR game rather than a disconnected third person flat game. 

The one major weakness is that the combat is rather poor. It gets the job done, though. There's nothing really mechanically wrong with it but it's just not all that satisfying. 

Overall, if you're at all interested in playing a survival horror game for VR, this is a great one. It's about 6-7 hours long which isn't bad for the $25 pricetag so go ahead and pick it up.

36429748.review:
I am so happy this exists. 

Organ Quarter is a survival horror game for the HTC Vive and Rift that very much tries to capture the glory of the golden age of horror; the PS2. Namely, this game is completely unashamed of its likeness to Silent Hills 2 and 3. I can't speak for Silent Hill 1 as I've never completed it myself but considering Silent Hill 3 is one of my favorite games, I can see the comparisons here in full. People are weird and awkward, constantly seeming detached from reality. The Environments are nightmarish and impossible. While Silent Hill tries to trick you into thinking you're in the real world and everything is safe, this game doesn't even try. You are in it from beginning to end. It's obvious that there is a layer of unreal to this game and I feel like it wears that like a badge of honor. 

The visuals are amazing, but the graphics are not. This is kind of a hard one because I personally like this graphical fidelity. This is going to age just fine because it looks a lot like the environmental design of Silent Hill 3. It looks old and that's okay. Plus, this means the game runs very, very well on most systems, as far as I can tell. But obviously, better graphical fidelity is always welcome. I just don't see a problem with this. The enemy designs are fine, certainly frightening if you are at all affected by body horror. The gunplay is fine but the focus on this game is the looming sense of doom and environmental unease. It's this games corner stone and god, if it isn't a strong one. 

The music is great. It's static ridden and tense when it needs to be but then it settles down when you reach a save point, giving you a good little resting point that feels good to be in. The composer for this game is, again, keeping pretty true to the Silent Hill formula, even if no one can top a music composition for this type of game like Akira Yamaoka.

I can't give a final opinion as I'm super early but this game is certainly worth looking at. If you have even the slightest inkling of interest in it, I think it's worth it. I'd been watching the game for a while. I played the demo a long time ago and it was okay but the finished product so far is a good bit more cohesive and feels less meh. I love it. Love it to death.

Continued: Without spoiling anything, this game stays consistently great. There's a point at about the 1 hour mark where things ramp up a little and it's not needed but it is welcome. This game just feels like an homage in a really wonderful way. It's a beautiful melding of classic survival horror and modern virtual reality interaction.

Complaint: At long last, I finally have something to complain about. And it's tiny. There comes a section in the game that has to do with doors. As silly as that sounds, I'm keeping it to avoid spoilers. But these doors don't have any sound effects. The don't have iron slide noises or creaking or anything and for just a second, it pulled me out of the moment. I got over it as I continued attempting to get the puzzle but even still. There are a few parts that are like this where the lack of sound to a particular action or object just made it feel less genuine but I can still accept it. Complaining finished, however, because I'm still enjoying this game more than I expected to. This is truly a fantastic VR game.

36426357.review:
Holy Guacamole. I Streamed this entire game on twitch @https://www.twitch.tv/ace1081 and it is by far the best singleplayer VR experience I have had the pleasure to have. So from my experience here is what it has to offer.

PROS:
-Multiple enviroments
-Amazing atmospere & Music
-Terrifying enemies that make you want to take the quiet route
-Feels like an old RES/SH game
-So immersive the world around you feels real & dangerous
-A clever boss
-Rescource managment!!!
-Multiple enemy types
-Controls work very well
-Its a full game!

CONS:
-2 Bosses where very shoot at them alot-like foes.
-Graphics, but thats for every VR game (Graphics stay true to the RES/SH old-likeness)
-NO DLC yet (Please Please Please take a look at res7 and make some DLC like ethan must die, also a mercanaries/survival mode)
-A few glitches with the puzzles making me have to reboot the game up from a previous save
-Where did my lady friend go?
-I had to get down on my knees and look through multiple glory holes to do a puzzle... (Funny not really a con)
-Music was a little loud at times causing other noises and sounds to be almost unheard.

VERDICT:
My first review ever and I had to do it on this piece of gold, 9/10 bugs got a little annoying but devs are working on them (prob already fixed) Best singleplayer VR experience I have had so far I can not reccomend this game enough to classic RES/SH fans. It feel alot like someone put SIlent hill 2 and resident evil 4 in a blender and out came Organ Qaurter.

So awesome! This is like a Silent Hill in VR. Great gameplay and music.

36144727.review: 好游戏，气氛一流，有当年玩《生化危机1》的感觉，希望能更新中文。

36097042.review: The graphics are great. Everything has a 3d texture to it. I'm really enjoying it so far. This is a must buy for VR.

36088559.review:
Good game! Intresting as alwais from indie, i was enjoy just to explore things and shoot the enemy.

i hope this experience will push the devs to make some another story or just anothe cool VR game as well!

36077313.review: Organ Quarter is such a breath of fresh air and at the same time it is very reminiscent of the first Resident Evil and Silent Hill 2. Finally a real survivor horror titlle that isn't just another shooting gallery. It plays like an actual video game with the enemies spouting out very creepy soundz from the underground (like 6 feet under) and they move around in an even creepier walk. There is a good amount of different enemies and bosses alike. Like others have said, this game is not about cheap jump scares just a full on sinister experience which makes this one of the best Horror VR titles to date. I have only played about 3 and 1/2 hours (still haven't played the first boss) but from what I have played feels like a AAA game by a AAA developer and even the environments made by the developers is quite unsettling and disturbing. If you are looking for something that has similarties to the 90's old skool survival horror yet is still fresh and loaded with the macabre don't look further and just pick this game up.

36060300.review: Highly recommended. One of the few VR games to give me sustained presence. Check this game out if you like the aesthetic and gameplay of the survival horror games that inspired this game.

36044613.review: Fantastic classic Silent Hill-esque survival horror experience.  No jumpscares so far but I still find it too disturbing/creepy to play in VR for extended periods, which I think is a good thing, just probably can't finish it until the desktop release!

36044260.review:
I'd recommand this to anyone who likes exploration and survival in disturbing environments.

performance/graphics are great, and the locomotion works really well, no motion sickness for me, even though i'm sensitive to it.

36031407.review: Disturbing, unnerving, and very enjoyable. I would recommend this to anyone who is a fan of horror. It's not high-octane action horror, it feels more like playing Silent Hill 2.

36018165.review:
'Tis the season for horror, if year-round counts as a season, and [b]Organ Quarter[/b] has no shortage to provide.

My favorite parts of this game are the soundtrack, voice acting, and the environments despite what some are saying about the graphics. It’s rare that I am legitimately scared by a videogame or even a feature length movie for that matter, but there are some downright creepy parts of the game that stuck with me for hours or days after the fact. There is plenty of rewarding puzzling and inventory management to instantly get any survival horror fan hooked, and while a bit too few things are left up to the imagination for my liking a-la Amnesia it’s basically first person Silent Hill which makes up for it.

Just like any other title in this burgeoning VR space rough edges tend to be exaggerated by the fact that developers are still having to push the boundaries and test uncharted waters, and while Organ Quarter has its share of quarks they hardly detract from the experience overall. The developer has also promised to continue with the quality of life updates, so you will probably have an even better experience than I did.

A classic horror title to help fill out a genre which is really lacking from the VR scene, at least with some real substance compared to what is out there. If you are considering at all getting this game I say do it and enter the Organ Quarter.

35999552.review: I'm sorry but this game is beyond boring. Graphics are horrible, monster sounds are from a 90's radio station, animations are stiff and the combat is incredibly dull and unsatisfying. I requested a refund. It's not worth any money for me.

35998712.review:
This is a great game for those looking for a classic Horror survival game, similar to Resident Evil or Silent Hill of old.

The Good:
Has a good atmosphere with plenty of creep factor.
Clean graphics.
Plenty of control customization.

The Bad:
Dated graphics.

Overall I'm loving the game, the graphics make me FEEL like I'm in the horror games of my past. I recommend this to anyone with the hardware.

35981996.review:
Was really hoping this game wouldn't be another haunted house jump scare fest, and as luck would have it, this isn't that at all.

Organ Quarter shares more in common with Silent Hill, I'd pretty much say this game is a first person Silent Hill, in the sense of atmosphere at least. If you like classic survival horror, then look no further. 

It starts off easy enough, but I very quickly found myself completely absorbed into its world, I am very eager to hop back in and continue pushing on through the Organ Quarter. [b] This is without a doubt, the best horror game avaliable for VR today.  [/b]

-------------------------------------------------

Other Notes

- Game works fine on my Oculus
- Options for comfort and locomotion style (Free/Teleport)
- Runs quite well on my 970, some particle heavy parts seem to slow it down somewhat (only for a second)

35980595.review: 10/10 One of the best VR games to date! To know that you made this game with just 2 people on your team makes it even better!

35979210.review:
Two types of People will and should buy this game. 

Person A : Wants to experience what it's like to step into a playstation 2 generation horror game such as Silent Hill 2.  Wants to experience an old school horror atmosphere with survival horror elements and weapon management.  Likes Freaky enemies and at least basic level puzzles. Wants to see what the best map system so far in a VR game is and thinks it would be a great idea to stick their head inside a TV that looks like a butt-hole.

or

Person B : Hates themself and is a masochist. 

I'm C, both of the above. Highly recommended.

35968407.review: Ad oggi l'esperienza più completa e soddisfacente provata in VR. Un survival horror classico che si rifà fortemente ai primi Silent Hill e affini, con elementi moderni all RE7 e che riesce ad immergere il giocatore come pochi altri sono riusciti a fare fino ad ora. Merito senza dubbio di un gameplay dritto e coerente, di puzzle pensati bene in grado di soddisfare il giocatore, di un'atmosfera splendida e di una delle colonne sonore più belle mai sentite in un videogioco horror contemporaneo. Se vi piacciono i survival horror ha tutti gli elementi che gli amanti del genere amano (tra cui anche delle belle, ma migliorabili, boss fight) ma senza la disonestà tipica delle produzioni meno sottili, mancando in toto di jumpscare gratuiti per dar spazio ad una tensione crescente, frutto esclusivamente del buon lavoro di level design. Per ora non è esente da difetti: la parte centrale è più debole del resto e ha diversi bug legati per lo più al teletrasporto (è comunque tranquillamente giocabile anche con il movimento tradizionale), ma Outer Brain Studios sta già lavorando per migliorare tutte le piccole sbavature che lo affliggono. La longevità è ben al di sopra della media dei titoli only vr, con circa sei ore necessarie per concludere l'avventura (a livello di difficoltà massimo, per quanto mi riguarda). Si può dire che Organ Quarter sia il primo vero survival horror per VR, e se il buongiorno si vede dal mattino la strada non può che essere in salita, sia per il genere che per Outer Brain Studios.

35966919.review: Super! Tolle Atmoshäre dank der genialen Musikuntermalung. Grafik ist stimmig und erinnert an die guten alten Silent Hill Zeiten. Mehr davon!

35960878.review: игра просто бомба! Эдакий местный silent hill для виртуальной реальности. Пока наиграл около полутора часов, надеюсь что она не будет короткой. Придраться в игре не к чему, всё сделано просто на высте. Надеюсь разработчики захоят сделать продолжение.

35958274.review: Highly recommend this game. If you like survival horror and you have a VR headset you should love this. Game has boss fights, exploration, puzzles, fixed save points, and inventory management. Like some people have said it is basically silent hill vr. On top of that the game has a dev who cares and is very active on the discussion boards.

35956537.review: Really enjoyed this game. I was hooked and pretty much played it non-stopped until I beat it. Took me 5 hours to beat it.

35950175.review:

My Initial Thoughts:

35945731.review:
Игра просто мечта для любителей классических хорроров по типу RE 1,2,3, Silent Hill, Evil within, но в VR. Присутствует полный набор для любителей классики: ограниченный боезапас, сундук с инвентарем, неторопливые монстры, в которых важнее точней прицелиться и потратить меньше патронов, чем палить от бедра, головоломки, сохранялки только в специальных безопасных местах с успокаивающей музыкой. Здесь нет бесконечных скримеров, экшена и заскриптованных мобов, игра не ставит целью напугать игрока во что бы то не стало, страшно становится от того, что у тебя осталось 3 патрона, а впереди дверь, из которой доносятся ужасающие звуки. 

Из плюсов я бы отметил атмосферность, музыку и графику (красивая детализация и не слишком пестрая картинка). Я минут 15 стоял просто на балконе, рассматривая вид из окна под удивительную музыку. Управление довольно простое и отзывчивое. Еще огромный фан доставляет работа с картой, на которой приходится вручную вычислять свое местоположение и отмечать различные посещенные/важные места.

Из минусов - почти отсутствует физика и нет возможности выйти в меню.

Очень доволен этой игрой, дай бог здоровья разработчикам, чтобы они продолжали в том же духе.

35920414.review:
デモ版の雰囲気が気に入ったので個人的に製品版発売を楽しみにしていた作品の１つで、古き良き時代のホラー作品を彷彿とさせる謎解きサバイバルホラータイトルである。
　ワープ移動とパッド移動の選択が可能、作中の雰囲気でジメジメとした恐怖を与えてくる作風である。
　戦闘は派手さは無いが限られた弾薬で対抗するスタイルでホラー作品としては問題なく、今のところ謎解き要素も難しすぎず良いバランスで、ホラーとして丁寧に作られている印象を受けた。
　バイオハザードやサイレントヒルの１作目的な雰囲気が好きなら、是非お勧めしたいタイトルの１つである。

35908006.review: Graphics are pretty bad but the game has a nice silent hill feel to it, there is room for improvement but this is a great start. Played it from start to finish in one go on the hard difficulty and it took about 4 hours to beat, controls are well done and locomotion feels good. I think it's worth a buy if you want a good VR singleplayer horror experience.

35906672.review: i consider myself an absolute VR horror wimp, but i still found this very rewarding/enjoyable. No jumpscares thank you thank you

35905693.review:
I've been wishing for a VR game with the hellish, corrupted and dark environment like in silent hill games, then ive found this!

Its great so far and it has managed to scare me a few times lol.

Using Oclulus with no problems.

Looking forward to their improvement updates.

Silent hill fans would love this.

Graphics is not up to todays games standard but graphics really isnt everything. Todays games with ultra realism graphics usually have pretty dull and boring gameplay. I do like this games graphics as its reminds me and gives me the silent hill vibes which i love. I would rather have the dev add more cool features and details etc than improving the textures.

35903544.review:
Pretty much like playing a Silent Hill game in vr. Environment graphics are a bit rough, but the monster and meat generally looks good. Sound is great, monsters make creepy noises, and the soundtrack is, well, like a silent hill game. Story is kind of vague for an hour or so, then it seems to start picking up more after you get out of the apartment building.

Not heavy on real jump scares, but is tense and I jumped a few times just from looking around a corner and spying a creature. Inventory and item managment important and adds to the tension. It's fun scavenging for items in the environment and trying to weave between monsters to conserve ammo. I also like how it makes you get down on the floor/crawl under stuff at times. Can be kind of intense when your sprinting for an item under a table or something with 4 monsters bearing down on you and you gotta get down on all fours to get the item.

Played on an occulus with touch, didn't encounter any issues other than when I went through a door it seemed to take a few seconds for my left stick to start working for movement. 

I imagine I'm Harry Mason when I'm playing it, I just write the stilted dialogue for myself.

35901601.review:
https://youtu.be/SBYiIuIksR4

OK wow!  I remember the first time I popped Resident Evil in my Playstation back when it first came out.  That first hallway where the zombie dog burst through the window and proceeded to rip my throat out.  As my charcter laid there in a pool of blood with YOU DIED on the screen all I could think was,.. This ,,, is,,, TERRIFYING!  I had never had that kind of experience before where a video game scared me.  Not at that viceral fight or flight instinctual level.  Organ  Quarter does this all over again.  The terrifying blacking out momentarily of the screen as you move through the door, the sounds all around you coming from ducts over head and distant rooms, behind doorways or around the corner, up ahead, un-seen.   It's exactly what this Dr. ordered! 

Graphically this game is not going to blow anyone away.  That being said what this team has done with their graphics just works.  The spaces feel great, claustrophobic and foreboding.   They are crisp and clear,. no need for super sampling and no frame drops.  The Character models are just great!  Creepy AF with a definite Silent Hill feel to them.  Nice enemy variety from the little close to 2 hours I've played as well.  I have never really been afraid of a spider in a game save the giant one in Resident Evil,. but the little spider dudes in this game are creepy AF and even killed me once!  There is another thing,. with the play style and feel of Resident Evil, I would compare it visually more toward Silent Hill.   Both Games that we have been wanting if you are a Survival Horror fan.   Yes I know there is RE7 but I don't have a PSVR.  

The Sound is excellent.  It has that late 80's/90's vibe to it with over bearing creepy ambient music, sounds that come from all directions and really help pull you into this terrible world and give you that sense of dread, even when it is mostly quiet with hardly any sound.  The devs did a great job of sound use not over doing it and using the silence just as effectivly.   I had to nope out of one room early on just because I walked in and it was dark, I had no weapon and all I could hear was this terrible crunching coming around the corner up ahead of me .  nope nope nope.  

You can choose teleport or analoge locomotion.  I chose the later.   It works great, moving where you are pointing your controller, slowing down when you pull back and speeding up with thumpad depression.  I didn't try the teleport so I can't comment on that one.   Anyway I noticed no simulation sickness at all and it felt really good moving through tight spaces in those rooms aiming around corners and avoiding bad guys to conserve ammo which brings me to my next point.

Gameplay.  This is really the shining gem of excellence in Organ Quarter!   I love the limited Inventory system, limited ammo,  save system,. all of it really is the old 90s survival horror we all love!  I really love horror in VR (as well as hate it because I'm a big chicken} but have yet to really see one capture that survival horror feel.  In Paranormal Activity, for example, you had "limited" batteries for your flashlight,. but did anyone actually run out of batteries?  I know I had a ton of them at the end of the game.  As polished as that game was graphically it cannot hold a candle to the game play and feel of Organ Quarter!  Go Outer Brain!! I also love the map!  great system of being able to mark the rooms you have visited with different stamps.  I use it a LOT!  The use of motion controllers is another thing that just makes these horror VR games so much better!  I think that is one thing I worry about if RE7 ever comes to the VIVE,. I'm going to be really dissapointed if I have to play with a game pad.  holding your gun up, whipping it around when your eyes open in the dark hallway you just entered,  reaching out and grabbing your stuff like ammo and other items,.. that is where things just need to be in VR.  none of this game pad nonsense! 

So YES YES YES I highly recommend Organ Quarter!  If you are a Survival Horror fan this game is an absolute MUST have in your VR library!  It is now my favorite VR horror game and I can't wait to get in and play more!  Once I can get up the courage!  Thank you Outer Brain for giving us a truley  great Survival Horror  experience!

35897391.review:
I'v had Vive for about a year and bought several games longing for S!lent H!ll in VR, this is it!

Full movement options blink/trackpad/click turn.

Basic puzzles and shooting with the use of an inventory. Classic hoard your ammo and health, but be sparing not like Ser!ous Sam.

True horror not to much shock horror so far, 1.5 hours in.

Deeply creepy monsters and surprises.

10/10 when compaired to what is available in horror VR now. I imagine we will see amazing VR horror in the next year or so.

I have 38 VR games and this is in my top 3 till fallout and doom hit the shelf then it will probably be top 5.

Dont forget to crawl under the bed!

35895026.review:
Survival horror fan since RE2 and SH1 here. After getting VR, the first games I dug into were the horror games of course and I was amazed by the possibilities. Most stuff to date is short and/or buggy, but the sense of fear in VR is much more real. That being said, I wanted a game that really got the genre right.
This is the thing.
The influences are obvious, but the designers have been very tasteful in their execution. Playing this, you will get the sense of fear, depression, disturbance, disgust...Everything we love about survival horror.
To the devs, PLEASE continue! Make more of this kind of thing and keep taking it as far as you can. This is exactly what our community is hungry for, and we want to keep journeying down that demented rabbit hole.

35885127.review:
Organ Quarter is basically our first Sillent Hill: VR. No jumpscares here- just good old fashioned "Oh geez, that's unsettling..." enviornments and enemies. For me so far, it's hit every note it's aimed at.

The graphics are fantastic. Some of the best I've seen in VR yet- and by that, I don't mean like "the gun has the highest res textures money can buy!' sort of graphics- I mean in how the whole game looks period. The graphics feel tailor made for VR. 

Enemies are intimidating alive, and creepy to look at dead. Letters with small text are readable (this is maybe the first VR game where that was possible for me). Things in the game look 'clear,' not blurry like in most early VR games. The flashlight casts moody shadows beautifully. If there are any anti-aliasing issues (that shimmer effect on the edges of objects like 90% of VR games have), I haven't noticed them. 

I'm honestly impressed at how nice everyting looks like game, and this *might* be up there close to Valve's The Lab in how 'made-for-VR' the visuals look in the headset. (Note:  do have SuperSampling enabled on my headset, but most of my games don't look *this* smooth, even with SS enabled.)

The audio deserves a special mention in this game for sure. The music is excellent - it sets the mood,  it doesn't get in the way, and it sounds great (it very much reminds me of the Silent Hill 2 soundtrack). Aside from the music, the other sounds in this game are *fantastic* and do an amazing job of adding to the dread you feel as you turn each corner, and open each door.

If you have even a passsing interest in errie games (no jumpscares here, remember!) You *need* this game!

35881384.review: Love the Mood and the way you made the save games is great (placing your head in the T.V).. But man i hate horror and V.R but i will keep playing and i will keep moving =) Great game

35876950.review:
[h1]ATTENTION: This review is spoiler free and mainly for you the potential customer and partially the developers.[/h1]

[i]ENEMIES AND JUMPSCARES[/i]

Organ Quarter is a trail-blazer for VR horror games. It does not rely on jump-scares although the monsters will certainly make you jump out of your skin at least once or twice with it's brilliant placement. The enemy variation is just right and their often sporatic movements can make for tense moments if you miss a shot and need to reload. This game has boss battles. This might be considered a spoiler to some (I do not consider it such as I am not detailing how many or what they are) but if you've played any survival horror games, you will pick it up before it happens and know when to expect them.

[i]BOSS FIGHTS AND GAME LENGTH[/i]

I bring up boss battles for the sake of critique. Most are done well but the final boss does feel like it could have been executed better. Following that thought, Organ Quarter feels like it slips in and out of a "padding trope" for the second half of the game. Don't get me wrong, I enjoyed the full experience a lot but at some point I feel like I would have traded the last 3 hours for another 1.5 hour of the first half. It took me 6 hours to complete Organ Quarter on the "Survival Horror" difficulty and (whichever way you look at it and as long as it doesn't completely suck) that is a great amount of play time versus dollar spent (especially since VR game lengths are often much lower than 6 hours).

[i]WORLD DESIGN[/i]

I can hear the critics now. "GRAPH1CZ MAK3 DAH GAM3!" And by this they mean "good graphics" or some standard that means all else is bust if visuals doesn't bleed realism. Organ Quarter does not have realistic graphics in the sense we see today... but you know, that is okay. I'd even say that is a bigger plus for Organ Quarter because it gives a better "nightmare" or "retro" feel... however you want to look at it. One of my favorite horror games is Cry of Fear and if you know what that is, you will know why "X engine" and "gud graffics" don't make the horror game.

[i]AUDIO[/i]

To a large part, the soundtrack makes the game. I don't think I will remember everything about this game years from now, but I can tell you that if I ever heard the soundtrack being blasted by someone driving down the road... it would be unmistakable. The dark, industrial , and electronic mixes really set the mood (or even parts where there is not music and dead silence). It's brilliant in the music department and without those rich tones... it wouldn't be the same. So what about the voice actor cast?

Dr. Alset and his voice actor is definitely the star of the show. Without the voice actors talent and emphasis, it might have been a car wreck in this department. You have a few other voice actors but (no offense actors) it feels a little "phoned in". The animations for the characters don't always feel like it matches how the in-game character is coming across but that is no fault of the v/o actor. You might have mixed feelings too but its nothing to avoid this game over.

[i]CONTROLS[/i]

VR is still an experimental field so there is no real "right way" to do VR. This game is made to work with both the Rift and Vive with angular snapping of the camera for those who do not have a 360 degree setup. You can choose to play with traditional movement of character or you can teleport. Teleportation is not recommended for the best experience but it is there in case you get sick by thumb-stick locomotion. Organ Quarter does survival horror right and gives you an inventory in-game that you need to manage which for the most part, translates well in interaction.

That is not to say that inventory interaction is without it's faults. Some puzzle items will be very annoying later when you need to set them outside of your inventory and use (only to pick up and go immediately in your inventory and not for use in your hand). It could use some tweaking but for the most part, this one puzzle in particular was the only main headache. Organ Quarter also implements save rooms very nicely (where you can only save the game and nowhere else, duh) which includes a proper box to store additional items when your on-person inventory is full. You will need to manage both inventories fairly frequent! Survival horror and inventory management... imagine that!

[i]FINAL THOUGHTS[/i]

Organ Quarter is definitely a good game if not in some parts "great" for how well it handles survival horror and effectively re-introduces it to us in VR. You can feel the strong Silent Hill vibes and whether you feel that is a cop-out for style and plot device... that is up to you. There are plenty of puzzles to figure out and some even make you feel smart. The added ability to get a map of your current level and place stamps on it to guide you... is genius as well. For an indie title and the work of a small studio, it is certainly the VR horror entry that Silent Hill and horror game fans will definately overall enjoy.

35866512.review:
Survival Horror in VR, spooky.

The atmosphere in the game is fantastic, with the player having to concentrate on resource management like in the old Silent Hill games, you feel dread coming over you as soon as you have something coming towards you, miss a couple of headshots and hear a click, frantically moving backwards as you wait for the reload to finish.

There's no jump scares I've ran into so far, everything is purely built through suspense, player error and disgusting visuals, awesome.

35857797.review:
I've been waiting for this game since the day I got my Vive, and I am not disappointed. This is the first VR game I've played that has felt like a true videogame. It captures the essence of a PS2 survival horror in an amazing way. While some of the graphics aren't technically stunning, they do an amazing job of setting the vibe. There's something about the stark contrast between the bleak walls and the visceral, sore-ridden enemies that makes me feel like what I'm experiencing is real, and a real threat to me. I don't really know how to explain it. Beyond that, the game's soundtrack is atmospheric and oppressive. I really admire it and I feel it adds so much to the game. Resource management is stressful in a good way that adds extreme tension to every shot you have to take. Despite most enemies being slow, lumbering monstrosities, they twitch and gyrate in ways that make their weak points move just so slightly out of your sweetspot, making them hard to hit in a way that is both fair and creepy, and in an overwhelming situation, each missed shot feels like one strike closer to your death. Some of the early enemies don't feel super threatening, but man, the third enemy type you can encounter nearly made me shit my pants. I just beat the first boss being only a little over an hour into the game, and if the devs are not over-exaggerating with their 5-8 hour estimate. I am SO excited to see what else this game has in store for me. Honestly, even with the little I've played, I could go on and on about how much I love this game.

One specific thing this game does visually is its use of complete darkness. One of the vive's main graphical limitations is the limited FOV, the black borders around my vision always remind me of the fact that I'm in a game (one day, PiMax, one day) but in a pitch black room illuminated only by a weak but sufficient flashlight, the darkness outside of your light is identical to the black borders. It feels so damn real. The first boss makes AMAZING use of darkness (I won't spoil anything :) ).

The only thing I dislike about this game are the stairs. I'm pretty much immune to VR sickness, so I have comfort settings at the minimum, but you cannot analog walk up stairs. You click on the railings and it warps you to the top. Not only does this take me out of the game immensely, it also makes me a tad nauseous as everytime you warp up the stairs you have to get a completely new bearing of your surroundings and find the next railing. And a lot of these damn staircases are multi-story. Would love if this could get changed.

If you can stomach a VR horror game, you owe it to yourself to play this. I'll update my review after I finish the game, but damn, Organ Quarter is fantastic.

35852979.review: After having waited more than a year to experience a silent hill vr game (or clone of one) I can whole heartedly say that the wait was absolutely worth it! If anyone is looking for an old school survival horror game like silent hill 1-4 or resident evil 1-3 this is that game you've been waiting for. Everything from the enemy design, to the puzzles, to the music, and of course the atmosphere scream old school horror. If any of you have played the organ quarter demo and wondered if you'll breeze through this game (on the non-casual difficulty) think again. I normally completed the demo (7 times total) with more than 30 rounds in my inventory and every med kit available without ever being damaged even one time. I had a feeling that the developers intentionally made the demo accessible but rest assured, you are in for a rough ride (as you should be) if it's a proper survival horror! There's some quality of life improvements that could be made but overall a solid 9/10!

39496968.review:
This game is great. For me it has the makings of a VR classic. Totally nailed it's intentions of a throwback to Res Evil and other awesome 90's horror games. It's plenty long, the music and ambient sounds are awesome, I personally think the graphic quality is a perfect fit, and its damn unsettling to be inside of. I'm just constantly on edge when I play this. My skin crawls and I watch my back even when nothing is happening. I'm simultaneously loving and hating the experience at all times. I like that it offers you places to just relish the VR experience without having to worry (I still worry) about anything bad happening before you go into... other areas. It gives good balance. 

Never thought I'd be relieved to see a TV filled with pulsating, beckoning meat.

39524537.review:
This is a pretty good VR Survival Horror game. It feels like a first person Silent Hill game (I've only played SH3, but it did feel a good bit like that, just in atmosphere, less in symbolic influences). 

The controls are okay, it would be cooler to be able to configure them a bit more, but there's more options to do so than in other games that I've played and the warnings are apt, 'smooth motion' is defineitly an option to avoid x3. You get 2 different types of movement available, Teleport and Locomotion (using the thumbstick to move). I used the locomotion controls and they were pretty good. There are several different camera options as well, for turning and such, Like smooth moving (which you can use the thumbstick to turn your character, which can end up nauseating), or an angle based camera option that when you flick the thumbstick, it'll move your camera like 30 degrees or something to whichever direction you has moved it to (it can be a little finicky. There can be some issues with picking up objects on the ground or in other hiding places as your control of the interaction hand can get 'stuck' in places and not end up highlighting what you need to pick up (or it does, and still doesn't pick it up).

The gunplay is okay, it's just basic hitscan tech, meaning that you can have trouble telling where your shots are firing at since there's no tracers or anything, but the guns have good ironsights for the most part which will allow you to aim pretty well. There's 3 different weapons that you'll be able to choose from, all still using the same hitscan tech, but each unique enough to be able to be useful in their own right. You can hold up to 2 guns at a time and there are no melee mechanics. 

The inventory management is alight, just standard survival horror stuff, sans inventory tetris. You get 8 inventory slots + 2 for the guns. Using health kits is interesting as you have to use it 'on you' which is neat as it's like sticking needles into your chest and stuff. Items are persistent across levels, which means that if you leave items somewhere, it'll be there when you get back. You get a stash that is available in some areas (mostly next to save points) where you can store items and retreive them from other stashes. On the 'easy difficulty' (there's only 2 difficulty options) you may end up with too many items to fit in your stash and somewhat makes the stash less useful since you're not actually using the items that you're being given. Key items take up inventory room and can also be stored in the stash, the stash is usually found in areas near where you need to use the key items, sans the final area.

Enemy variety is pretty interesting, I counted about 8 or 9, though you'll encounter all but two of them in the first 'area'. Each enemy has different mechanics, such as movement speed, attacks, health, etc. There are 3 bosses, each with different mechanics as well, but in general they are somewhat similar in tactics, with just their arena being significantly different between them. 

The length of the game, while only about 4 hours in play time is a bit of a stretch. The enemy variety, being capped at near the half-way point leaves a bit to be desired near the ending stretch. Introduction of enemies would have been better saved for being spread out over the levels to increase tension of new encounters and such, in my opinion.

The npcs and the story are pretty good and interesting, though the backstory that you read through the notes scattered through the level aren't terribly interesting. You'll have about 5 different interactions with NPCs across the levels.

The locations, of which there are about 7, are also pretty cool. The most interesting place, the 'outdoor' city area, also happens to be the most poorly optimized, which causes a ton of framerate dips and such even with a 1080. 

Overall this is an Okay/Good game. It could be better, but it's what I would consider to be one of the better if not of the best of the VR survival horror games that are available at the time of this writing. I would say that it's worth the money that it is being offered for.

39514291.review:
Wow, what an experience!

One of the best VR-Games i´ve played so far.

+ great atmosphere
+ awesome soundtrack
+ oldschool game (like some old Resi Game)
+ no (cheap) scarejumps
